titleInfo.title: Brought to the Police Prison of First District.

mods.abstract: BROUGHT to the Police Prison of the First District -- JOHN, a Black, about twenty years old, five feet eight and a half inches high ; says he belongs to Mr.Barrington. WILLIAM, a Black, about twenty-eight years old, five feet two inches high ; says he belongs to Mr. Barrington. MILTON, a dark Griff, about seven years old, four feet high ; says he belongs to Mr. Launge. EFFY, a Black, about sixty-eight years old, four feet eleven inches high ; sasys she belongs to Mr. Hess. ELIZA, a Black, about eight years old, four feet one inch high ; says she belongs to Mrs. Smith. The owners will please comply with the law respecting them. J. WORRALL, Warden. NewOrleans, June 7, 1852. je7 1aw3w
mods.note: Mr. Barrington; Mr. Launge; Mr. Hess; Mrs. Smith

detail.title: New Orleans daily crescent. ([New Orleans, La.]) 1851-1866

mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
